title: GPU & CUDA Driver Issues
description: Fix GPU detection, CUDA compatibility, and driver crashes during AI workloads.

steps.title: Verify GPU Detection
steps.instruction: Run 'nvidia-smi' in Command Prompt. If it fails, the driver is not installed or the GPU is not recognized.

steps.title: Update NVIDIA Drivers
steps.instruction: Download latest Studio or Game Ready drivers from NVIDIA. Enterprise users should use 'Studio' drivers for better stability.

steps.title: Check CUDA Toolkit Version
steps.instruction: Run 'nvcc --version'. Ensure your PyTorch/TensorFlow version supports the installed CUDA version.

steps.title: Increase TDR Delay
steps.instruction: Registry Editor â†’ HKLM\System\CurrentControlSet\Control\GraphicsDrivers. Add 'TdrDelay' (DWORD) set to 60. This prevents Windows from resetting the driver during long AI tasks.

steps.title: Verify Library Path
steps.instruction: Ensure CUDA_PATH and PATH environment variables include the bin/lib directories of your CUDA installation.
